title: Add 256 color palette
body:
I've been working on a theme for Mutt and figured it might be helpful to include a 256 color palette in the README; this will be particularly handy for theming terminal applications and will save people having to figure it out like I did. I've added the palette to the first column as the current order seems to be basic (hex) -> complex (HSL).

The following script can display the colors in a terminal for validation:
```
#!/usr/bin/env bash

for i in {16,236,231,61,117,84,215,212,141,210,228}; do
    printf "\x1b[38;5;${i}mcolour${i}\n"
done
```

title: Tweak vim selection color to be more distinct
body: ## Tweak Vim selection color (visual mode) Current color is not so distinct on some displays, see #156. ## Screenshots The selection color is alike the background color, making it difficult to distinct: With the change, it looks more obvious: I believe this really depends on the display and `personal eye` but perhaps this tiny change would make the selection more obvious.

title: Add gedit install steps
body: See #185

title: Add Dracula theme for Gedit
body:
## Installation steps:
1. Download the raw file:

``` bash
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/richin13/dracula-theme/master/gedit/dracula.xml
```
1. Move the file to gedit style's folder

``` bash
$ mv dracula.xml $HOME/.local/share/gedit/styles/
```

Activate in Gedit's preferences dialog

![alt text](http://i.imgur.com/paelbpq.png)

title: Updated repository for the migration.
body:
Now that we're nearly complete with the migration, I've started working on updating this repository. This repository will eventually be moved to https://github.com/dracula/dracula-theme as the entrance point for creating new themes, requesting new themes, etc.

Todo:
- [x] Change url to dracula icon to link against the site using a pretty url rather than github's content.
- [x] Finalize the Team section (not quite sure what to do with it yet)
- [x] Change History section to Changelog
- [x] Change Roadmap section to FAQ as it's more of an FAQ than a roadmap.
- [x] Remove unused issue labels
- [x] Remove unused wiki pages
- [x] Remove content from gh-pages branch and add an index.html with a redirect to https://draculatheme.com

Future: 
- [x] Add explanation about the exclusion of UI themes
- [x] Add instructions for adding a new theme

Considering:
- [ ] Add links to each repository
- [x] Add a history section explaining the history of the theme and the changes that have gone on with the migration
- [x] Reorganizing the order of the sections to move the more important information to the top

title: Update Pygments theme support
body:
Hi @zenorocha and @Mottie!

This pull request addresses #61, providing some updates to the Pygments CSS theme that @Mottie had generated. It also includes the `dracula.py` file so that users can generate their own CSS file if they wish.

Definitely welcoming any improvements to the `dracula.py` file. üê¥ 

**To-Do**
- [x] Add the `dracula.py` file.
- [x] Update the `dracula.css` file.
- [ ] Design a Pygments icon and add a page to the website.

I tested the CSS using Rouge (which supports Pygments themes), and it works pretty well (see screenshot below)! There are some differences that are likely unavoidable due to how Pygments interprets syntax, but overall I think its pretty decent. 

![syntax-highlighting-test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/15344045/e6eab9fa-1c70-11e6-8a4f-56c545772db9.jpg)

title: Fixed README for who can actually publish the site.
body:
A contributor cannot publish, only a collaborator can. Contributors are
simply anyone who has ever committed anything that has been merged in.

Also renamed the README to be capital which is the standard.

title: refine instructions for Installing using Atom
body: In the current version of Atom (1.7.3), themes are installed on the _Install_ tab rather than the _Themes_ tab. I also made the search term more specific so that this theme is the first match. See also #166. Look ok  @JimmyMultani ?

title: honor bg=dark under cygwin ssh sessions
body:
If the user is in a cygwin window and connects via ssh to a linux box via 'vagrant ssh', the vim session does not honor the background=dark specified in the theme. 

This patch adds two lines at the bottom of the theme to (again) set the background and highlight clear.  The result is that the resulting vim session finally 'is' bg=dark as desired.

title: Add support for JetBrains IDEs
body:
Hi @zenorocha!

This commit adds a new `/jetbrains` directory with a `Dracula.icls` color scheme file. This file was generated from the existing `Dracula.tmTheme` file using the [JetBrains colorSchemeTool](https://github.com/JetBrains/colorSchemeTool). It also updates the description in the README.md file with a link to the JetBrains website (in alphabetical order).

In theory, this color scheme should work for all [JetBrains](https://www.jetbrains.com/)/[IntelliJ](http://www.jetbrains.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=983889) IDEs, but I have only been able to test it with [PyCharm 5.0.4](https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/) on OSX 10.11.3, where it appears to be working nicely (see below).

**Python**

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 28 48 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023769/5c474018-f1bc-11e5-8397-eba8bc707697.png)

**Django**

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 30 58 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023811/92ad1614-f1bc-11e5-8beb-f4aa6f3dcd5b.png)

**HTML (with inline CSS and JavaScript)**

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 28 20 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023775/65bdf128-f1bc-11e5-825c-53382b82b458.png)

**CSS**

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 28 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023799/80899f34-f1bc-11e5-8112-eaab50229016.png)

**JavaScript**

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 28 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023801/8402f30e-f1bc-11e5-9779-866f66645485.png)

Oddly, PyCharm comes pre-loaded with UI Theme and Color Scheme called **Darcula** (a pun on Dracula/Dark, presumably), but the color scheme is definitely different (see below).

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 12 34 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1480677/14023907/089f3988-f1bd-11e5-9e92-78455c2b61ec.png)

I noticed there is already [an open pull request for adding PyCharm support](https://github.com/zenorocha/dracula-theme/pull/55), but it looks fairly outdated which is why I opted to create a new one. If you end up wanting to merge this pull request, there are still some outstanding items that would need to be completed (see below).

**To-Do**
- [x] Add `/jetbrains` directory with `Dracula.icls` theme file.
- [x] Add JetBrains link to the description in the `README.md` file.
- [x] Update repository description to include JetBrains.
- [x] Add JetBrains illustration, page, and page content for the accompanying website.

Hope you‚Äôll consider it. I look forward to your response. Thanks! :v:

title: Emacs improvements
body:
which-func-mode uses a horrible heuristics to define the face used on
the mode-line. Notably, when using dracula theme, which-func-mode-face
will have foreground color Blue1, which is an eyesore when combined with
dracula theme.

This fixes the problem by making sure we are using the same foreground
as function-names.

title: Fix for Atom themes with Dynamic UI
body:
When activating the theme in Atom, if you have an atom theme with a dynamic UI such as Material UI (https://atom.io/themes/atom-material-ui) the theme will not work correctly as it cannot see what colours are being used by the Syntax theme. 

What can happens is you get something like below
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1415692/12237162/38e91acc-b875-11e5-856d-829b0251f35e.png)

I have moved all the styling in a base.less file and within that have included `syntax-variables.less` In here you can set the colours that the syntax uses and allow the dynamic ui themes to adjust accordingly. 

Here is what it looks like now on the material UI theme. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1415692/12237249/b5e2a890-b875-11e5-99a2-7d7b56cb295f.png)

title: Follow Atom Syntax standards
body:
Hey @zenorocha!

I noticed that your syntax theme did not work on a few themes that are widely used on Atom.

This pull request should fix issue #81 as it now follow Atom's syntax requirements for themes.

Hopefully, you can test this out soon! :)

title: blue for vim-go
body:
my goal was to make dracula support for vim-go to be as close as its support for go in sublime

this adds the missing blue highlighting for go's types (eg byte, int), builtins (eg len, append), methods (eg Println).

it seems that string and chan are grouped together under goType, which is unfortunate cause I would prefer them to be different colors.

all syntax highlighting should be enabled in vim-go, ie

let g:go_highlight_functions = 1
let g:go_highlight_methods = 1
let g:go_highlight_structs = 1
let g:go_highlight_operators = 1
let g:go_highlight_build_constraints = 1

title: QtCreator syntax highlight
body:
Syntax style applied for QtCreator.
Just copy dracula.xml to:
- Linux:  `~/.config/QtProject/qtcreator/styles`
- Windows (7 and up): `Users\<user name>\AppData\Roaming\QtProject\qtcreator\styles`

Start (or restart) QtCreator and select the Dracula color scheme in the options dialog.

title: Fix case of g:colors_name
body: I always got an error when starting vim that there is no colorscheme named `Dracula`, because it has to be set as `colorscheme dracula` but `g:colors_name` was used in `syntax/synload.vim` on line 19 and was set to `Dracula`, so I changed that and now I don't get this error anymore, which is nice...

title: Ulysses theme
body: Wrote a port of Dracula to [Ulysses](http://ulyssesapp.com). I updated the README.md file with instructions on how to install the theme. Screenshots: ![img_0058](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10686291/10810202/a1d48606-7dbb-11e5-885d-ba4b4d6f379d.PNG) In order to keep with the patterns for the screenshot URLs, I pointed the screenshot URLs in the README file to http://zenorocha.github.io/dracula-theme/assets/img/screenshot-ulysses-mac.png and http://zenorocha.github.io/dracula-theme/assets/img/screenshot-ulysses-ipad.png (note: GitHub doesn't seem to want to let me pull request my Ulysses commits without pull requesting my Coda commits, unfortunately. The Coda pull request is #101)

title: Use actual filename casing
body:
On OSX, by default, the filesystem is case-preserving, so locating
Dracula works fine. However, many linux filesystems are case-sensitive
so `colorscheme Dracula` causes the colorscheme to not be found.

title: Add Bold Text color to terminal theme
body: Currently the Bold Text color is not specified for the terminal theme, so Bold Text defaults to black, which is hard to read against the dark background. This sets the color of Bold Text to #6B75FF, which doesn't collide with the ANSI colors used.

title: Emacs Love
body:
This adds my port of the dracula theme for Emacs.

Issue with discussion: #93 

I added a link to a screenshot in the README, but you're probably going to want to add that to all the other assets and update the URL.

NOTE: I will need to make a PR to [MELPA](https://github.com/milkypostman/melpa) to add the following recipe to `recipes/dracula-theme`.

``` elisp
(dracula-theme :fetcher github
               :repo "zenorocha/dracula-theme"
               :files ("emacs/*.el"))
```

title: Added mintty
body:
Did the best I could to get it looking somewhat similar to the iTerm/Terminal.app versions and based it mostly off the given colour palette.

I didn't include an image in the Readme as they're in another repo, but you could use the one attached here.

Thanks so much for your work on this colour scheme. I love it to pieces, and it's the first one I've really been bothered enough about to create a colour scheme for on my Windows box.

title: An attempt at a Dracula Sublime Text UI theme
body:
![default-configuration](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/499636/6989615/a3d4a5aa-da12-11e4-95d3-380c269e6bfb.png)

This is my attempt at creating a Sublime Text UI theme that fits in with the awesome syntax color scheme. I'm not a user interface designer, so any feedback is welcomed. There are a few more screenshots at the bottom of the pull request that illustrate its customization options.

Interested in merging this? I've coded it up such that it should fit into the Dracula Color Scheme Sublime package.

title: Move xml declaration to top of file.
body:
In it's current state when other plugins try to open the Dracula.tmTheme, it return a `xml.etree.ElementTree.ParseError: XML or text declaration not at start of entity: line 13, column 0` when trying to create a plist from ElementTree.XML()

Closes SublimeLinter/SublimeLinter3#192

title: Make compatible with atom-text-editor shadow DOM
body: As discussed in our latest [blog post](http://blog.atom.io/2014/11/18/avoiding-style-pollution-with-the-shadow-dom.html), we'll be transitioning Atom's text editor to use the shadow DOM to avoid accidental styling conflicts. Since you have a really popular syntax theme, I thought I'd save you the trouble of reading through our [upgrade guide](https://atom.io/docs/v0.147.0/upgrading/upgrading-your-syntax-theme) and just make the changes for you. Please check to make sure everything works just in case I missed something specific to your theme, but this should be straightforward. Thanks!

title: Netbeans integration
body:
Hi i'm added the netbeans configuration and also im added the screenshots in netbeans folder

To Install follow this steps:

1.- Create a Zip of dracula folder into netbeans folder
2.- Go to Netbeans / Preferences / Fonts & colors /
3.- Press Import button and select the Zip created in step 2
4.- Reload netbeans

PD. I'm attached the editor examples to update de Readme if you want

![css-example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4997549/4495682/f34f6d1c-4a5d-11e4-861b-787a5c2c482a.png)
![html-example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4997549/4495683/f352f6ee-4a5d-11e4-9b09-c33427357c17.png)
![javascript-example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4997549/4495684/f356035c-4a5d-11e4-8fd0-3d84f7d6c8cb.png)
![php-example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4997549/4495685/f358a4d6-4a5d-11e4-8466-70d46d6b6314.png)

thank you

Change the value to 233,234,235,236 makes the theme work acceptable or setting ctermbg=NONE will take the backgroundcolor from iterm.

title: Visual Studio
body:
Hi, I created a Dracula vssettings theme for Visual Studio and I would greatly appreciate it if you took the time to take a look at it.  Please forgive me if I am doing something incorrectly as I am a novice when it comes to contributing on github.  

I believe this will be compatible with many versions of Visual Studio, if you check it out on studiostyl.es, you have the option to download it for many different versions and you can see a very detailed preview.  http://studiostyl.es/schemes/dracula-1

Thanks!
## Visual Studio

![studiostyle](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/696547/1461628/8166ae8a-44bf-11e3-94a0-28d805b68bc9.png)
### Preview/Download at studiostyl.es

http://studiostyl.es/schemes/dracula-1
### Installing
1. In Visual Studio, choose Tools > Import and Export Settings
2. Choose Import Selected Environment Settings and select whether you want to back up your existing settings or not
3. Click Browse... to choose the file you downloaded.
4. You get a choice which settings you want to import - choose all of them since the file only contains color settings and won't touch your other VS settings.
5. Click Finish and you'll see the new colors.
